title: Falling Again and Again
poem: நான் விழுந்துவிட்டேன், ஆம் உண்மைதான் நான் விழுந்துவிட்டேன், ஒரு தடவை அல்ல பலமுறை விழுந்துட்டேன். முதலில்

title: If a Million Loved You
poem: If a million loved you, I am one of them, and if one loved you, it was me, if no one loved you then know that I am dead.

title: All Angels Bear Her Name
poem: I’m tired of describing her as an angel over and over again... From now on, I’m going to call all angels by her name!

title: The Grammar of Us
poem:
"You" can be described in any way.
"I" can also be described in any way.
But who "we" are can only be described through love and completed in that very love.

title: Nothing to Hide
poem:
"I have nothing to hide from you.
If I don’t speak to you, you may ask about the past days."

title: The Saree’s Charm
poem:
"I’ve bought a new saree just for you.
As always, wear it and make this saree even more beautiful with your charm."

title: Etched into My Soul
poem:
"Back in school, I used to stay up day and night memorizing poems that were sure to appear in exams.
Today, she has become that memorized poem, etched into my soul.
For as long as I live, forgetting her is impossible.
Even if someone wakes me up from my grave one day, I’ll narrate pages and pages about her without hesitation."

title: Her Greatest Desire
poem: In his love, her greatest desire was always to be his first priority.

title: Restrooms and Love
poem:
"There's a restroom here; if you need to go, just go and come back," he would say. Yet, she would reply, "It's fine, I can manage," and follow him.
But soon enough, with an embarrassed face, she would admit she needed to use the restroom.
Even then, without a hint of anger, he would gently say, "I told you earlier," and promptly search for a restroom just for her.
In love, he spent more time finding restrooms to keep her comfortable than seeking privacy to satisfy his own desires.

title: River Under the Umbrella
poem:
In the pouring rain,
A river twists and turns,
Flowing within the confines of an umbrella!

title: A Blessing Named Her
poem: If there wasn't a woman like her I would have been a simple, ordinary man. She is a blessing to me

title: Surrender to Your Love
poem:
My dearest love, my entire existence and every action of my love revolve around your presence!
The closeness of love and the trembling of love are both determined by the state of your presence.
Will time bow down, allowing me to surrender at the hands of your love,
Or will I die waiting for the day when you grasp my outstretched hands?

title: Why Take My Life?
poem:
With so many marketplaces around,
Why do you insist on taking my life?

title: Afraid of Your Love
poem:
You say you love rain but you open your umbrella.
You say you love the sun but you find a shadow spot.
You say you love wind but you close your windows.
This is why I am afraid when you say you love me.

title: The Foolish Husband
poem:
Even the napkin she uses is criticized and shamed,
Yet I, a stranger to her, protect her with utmost care.
You call yourself a lover, a husband,
But the moment those three days arrive, you distance yourself, fool of a man.

title: Poetry is Tamil, You Are Poetry
poem:
No matter how many languages exist, poetry belongs solely to Tamil.
You are the poetry, and I am the Tamil.

title: A Lifetime of Kisses
poem:
The wandering moon has so much love to hear from the sky, yet it never seems to have the time to listen.
Likewise, I wonder if this one lifetime is enough to deliver all the kisses and love I hold for you.

title: Crossing Boundaries for Your Heart
poem:
The most beautiful wonder in the world is your heart.
Maybe that’s why I had to cross so many boundaries to enter it.

title: Memory Turns Dawn to Spring
poem:
It’s your memory that wakes me gently at dawn, turning the day into spring.
Come to me soon—I’m longing to live, but only with you.

title: No One Else but Her
poem:
You seem certain that she’s the one you want?
I’m certain that no one else but her is what I need!

title: Until My Final Breath
poem:
My love for you isn't just until you are here—
It lasts until the day I take my final breath.

title: Secrets Even You Don’t Know
poem:
"The kind of love I have for you is this—
I know things about you that even you don’t know."

title: The Moon in a Mirror
poem:
I asked you what you wanted,
And you said, "The moon!"
So, I gifted you a mirror instead!

title: Forever Radiant
poem: "you are always beautiful" – for when adorned by my love, you are forever radiant in my eyes.

title: More Beautiful Than Yourself
poem:
Do you know?
You are more beautiful than even yourself.

title: A Heartfelt Wish
poem:
At dawn, I yearn to embrace you tightly without fail,
And when you scold me to let go, to steal a kiss before rising.
When you sleep past dawn, I wish to gently place a kiss on your forehead,
Not disturbing your slumber, and quietly take care of all responsibilities.
While you’re unaware in the kitchen,
I dream of sneaking in a kiss on your neck, washing the vegetables I chopped to assist,
And presenting the meal to you with love.
Dropping you at the office and heading to work myself,
Then, at the end of the day, welcoming you with open arms when you return exhausted.
In bed, asking you gently if you’re comfortable,
And after everything, staying awake just to ask, “Are you truly satisfied?”
When you’re unwell, massaging your hands and feet,
Staying by your side until your fever subsides, making our home the safest haven for you.
Spending time on the beach, savoring roadside snacks,
And on weekends, venturing into nature to relish its beauty together.
Dreaming of a little puppy or kitten, and if neither pleases you,
Then together, creating a little family of our own.
When our child, born through your immense strength and sacrifice, arrives,
Loving them deeply, yet cherishing you even more until my last breath.
Living my dreams without imposing anything you dislike,
Never hurting you by doing what doesn’t please you,
And sharing a life together until the very end—this is my heartfelt wish.

title: The Angel in White
poem: Dear thief's be ready there is one women is coming to the area with white dress if you see her your all sins will forgiven because she is a Angel.

title: A Shoulder to Lean On
poem:
All I need right now is just a shoulder to lean on—a love without pretense, one that doesn't leave midway after reminding me of its temporariness.
A love that doesn’t discard me after being used,
A love that asks, even once a day, "Are you doing okay?" and grants me the strength to live longer.
When I feel lost, a love that reassures me with, "I’m here for you."
When I feel empty, a love that tightly holds my hand, showing everything through a single touch.
Just one shoulder is enough to give me all this—
To turn my heavy heart into a butterfly and send it flying around the world again!

title: Pain Behind a Smile
poem: The pain hidden behind a small smile is far deeper than the pain dissolved in tears!

title: Mercy in Your Arms
poem: Show me a little mercy—I wish to lie down and sleep in the warmth of your arms...

title: Don’t Go
poem:
When I say, "I'll be back," and prepare to leave you, you hold my hands, your heart heavy with tears, and plead, "Don't go."
This "Don't go" of yours only deepens my love for you even more.

title: You Are My Life
poem: From the moment you entered my life until now, you have been the biggest part of it. May it stay this way until the day I am no more.

title: For Us
poem:
For you,
I have done nothing.
And I am not going to do anything either. Loving you is not just for you.
Yes! Everything that happens between us isn’t only for you—or only for me.
It’s for us, that’s all.

title: The Only Beauty in My World
poem:
It’s true that you’re not the world’s beauty,
But in my world, you’re the only beauty.

title: Beyond Goddess
poem: It would have been nice if there were a state beyond that of a goddess. Even if there were, it would only be suitable for you.

title: The Weight of Your Affection
poem: Such a big love, they say. As if I'd throw everyone away, as if I'd be willing to lose everything. They keep asking me this. Poor them, they don't know the weight of your affection for me.

title: Bliss in Falling
poem: Even crying is bliss when there's a companion to console, even falling is sweet when there's love to lift you up.

title: Light After the Stars Die
poem:
Just as a small light shining in the distant darkness, after the moon and stars have died, is a source of great hope
you are like the light for me

title: Fall in Love with Yourself
poem: If you had seen yourself through my eyes, you too would have fallen deeply in love with you, just as I have.

title: Stadium of My Heart
poem: Her eyes, like a soccer ball, are constantly in motion! My heart has turned into a stadium. Amidst this fast-paced game, her glances serve as commercial breaks, giving me brief moments to pause and allowing my hormones a little respite.

title: The Saree’s Magic
poem:
Whether it's a cotton saree, silk saree, or any other kind,
Be it inexpensive or costly,
Any saree can enhance a your femininity,
Transforming her into a beautiful doll,
A divine art piece,
A blooming flower in the world,
Or a celestial angel.
The saree she wears adds to her beauty.
Her smile, mixed with the saree, gives a refreshing chill.
A saree's beauty is elevated when worn by you.
Otherwise, it remains a mere object in a cloth store.

title: Your Eyes, My Sky
poem:
In the flicker of your eyes, my world revolves;
In the blink of your eyes, the day and night of my sky change.

title: Miracle of My Mornings
poem:
Even when I lie awake through the night, yearning for your sight,
The moment I open my eyes to your face, my heart takes flight.
You are the miracle of my mornings, the source of my delight.
My dearest, you're always by my side, day and night.

title: Miles Deepen Yearning
poem: The miles that separate us seem to stretch endlessly, deepening my yearning for you. Oh, how I wish you were here, right now, in my arms. I miss you terribly.

title: Words Fail My Love
poem: You're my everything. My love for you is boundless. When I attempt to articulate these feelings, my heart overflows with emotion. Words fail to capture the depth of my love for you.

title: Only You
poem: Only you, only you can make my heart soar like this. Only you can fill my heart with joy. You can even make me forget my worst days and comfort my heart. My heart, which doesn't listen to anyone else, is now captivated by your words. All my heart wants now is you. Thanks for being with me. Love you.

title: Hold Me Tight
poem: When you see me, hold me tight without a second thought. I'll cry then, and with those tears, my yearnings will melt away.

title: Life’s Gift
poem: Life is a gift that bestows unexpected joy and fills one with love. It introduces strangers, connecting hearts and sharing the happiness of love. You are the gift life has given me.

title: Cuckoos Teach Love
poem: The two cuckoos perched on the electric wire are teaching me how to love.

title: Longing at Dawn
poem: Every time I wake up, there's a longing in my heart, wondering if you'll be there in my expectations.

title: Beauty, Happiness, Life
poem: In love, there is beauty, happiness, and life. I've realized all of this because of you. I love you more than I can express, and my heart is filled with joy because of your love. Love you.

title: Demon of Beauty
poem: Gentlemen, safeguard your hearts. The demon of beauty is approaching, hunting hearts with her gaze.

title: Stumbling Flowers
poem:
Without knowing what a garden is,
All the flowers seem to stumble, O star-like one,
Since seeing you in a saree.

title: Moon Out of Reach
poem:
Dear,
Because you’ve reached only my sight and not my fingertips, like the moon that’s out of reach,
I long for you, counting the days and nights.
Seeing the beauty of the saree you wore!

title: Act Like a Child
poem: I'll give you everything your father forgot/refused to give you, in return - just act like a child, that's all.

title: Violence in Comparison
poem: Asking someone why they are different from others is a huge act of violence.

title: Rainbow in a Saree
poem:
Like a rainbow, so wondrous to see,
Adorned in a saree, you stand before me.
Like a child seeing a rainbow for the first time,
My eyes widen in awe and wonder.

title: Butterfly’s Fall
poem:
Even the butterfly, that used to search for a path,
Today, with its eyes searching, has come and fallen
Into your eyes, my love,
After seeing your beautiful saree

title: Birds Forget the Grove
poem:
All the birds that used to seek the grove
Today they forget the grove and wander
Behind your beautiful saree

title: Eyelids Forgot to Blink
poem:
My eyelids forgot to blink...
Ever since I saw you with a  adorned in a saree...

title: A Moment Like Thunder
poem:
A cloudless blue sky! Your face without makeup!
A lone bird soaring through the sky! 
My finger grazing your lips!
A creeping cloud! A blanket hiding shyness!
Thunderous lightning! A battle waged by lips!
The following drizzle! Drops of love spilled!
That was such a moment!
You are such a beauty!

title: I Am a Prince
poem: I am also a 'prince', because there is a 'princess' to 'love me' too!!

title: Kohl-Lined Course Change
poem: My thoughts change their course, the moment I see her kohl-lined eyes.

title: Love Arrows
poem: Every time you blink eyes, You shoots a love arrow into my heart.

title: Love My Sole Companion
poem: For as long as I live, love will be my companion. And that love, entirely and solely, will be for you.

title: Root of Your Being
poem: Your beauty is like flowers, blooming one day and wilting the next. But what I truly love is the root of your being, your heart.

title: Vivid Dreams of Her
poem: Last night, I had vivid, colorful dreams, and all I saw was her face.

title: Created to Describe
poem:
She was created to be described,
I was created to describe her,
....because of her, I am.....

title: No Other Way
poem: I don't want to live any other way; just living with you is enough.

title: Eyes Open to You
poem:
My eyes, which opened to the sound of your message in the morning, close at night with the beautiful memories of you.
Throughout the day, songs about you continue to play in my heart. 
Even though you are far away, I keep your memories close to me.
I fill my sleep and dreams with your thoughts, without fail. Please come to my life tomorrow as well, my full moon.

title: Office Calendar New Year
poem: Had I known you would come like this, a celestial beauty, I would have turned every day of the office calendar into New Year.

title: Definition of Love
poem: Being attracted by her beauty, becoming a slave to her love, desiring to be a garment for her body, surrendering to her for life, I would call that "love".

title: Garments of Shame
poem: Even with a naked body, she is adorned with the 'garments of shame'

title: No Tears from You
poem:
Even though there are millions of hearts in the whole town, my heart only asks for your love.
I have filled all sides of my heart with love for you.
My biggest prayer is that I should not even see a single tear from you.

title: Child Watching a Butterfly
poem: Just like a child watching a butterfly, I’m captivated by the way she blinks her eyes.

title: Peacock Feather in a Book
poem:
Just like a child who treasures a peacock feather between the pages of a book,
I keep adding your beauty to the lines of my poems!
Hoping it will double.

title: Choose Your Pet Name
poem: Choose one of these: love, desire, kiss, pain, longing, laughter, separation, murder, death, wound, shame. Make it your pet name! You're the perfect match for me for all of these.

title: Crescent Moon Realization
poem: I used to think the full moon was the most beautiful. But only after living in the world of your smiles, have I realized that the crescent moon is the real beauty.

title: Moon More Beautiful After You
poem:
After talking to you for a little while...
The moon looks even more beautiful than before...

title: Ruin My Sleep
poem:
It's not like you're incredibly beautiful or anything, to be honest!
What?!
If I were to see you, you would ruin my sleep for the next 4-5 days, giving me all sorts of dreams!
That's why I'd agree that you're incredibly beautiful during those times!

title: Crescent Moon Eyes
poem: After hiding the full moon, those two eyes reflect like a crescent moon... My heart! Like the new moon!

title: Finest Poem, Fairest Face
poem:
Your name is the finest poem I've read,
Your face, the most beautiful painting I've seen,
All beautiful things remind me of you,
And everything that reminds me of you is beautiful,
Words fail to describe your beauty,
If only I had a violin, I would play a tune for you...

title: Gravitational Gaze
poem:
Her gaze has a gravitational pull stronger than the Earth's.
Her languid gaze sets my world spinning with every turn.

title: Natural Beauty’s Slave
poem: Sneha, I've already lost my heart to your natural beauty; don't try to enslave me further with embellishments.

title: Morning of Love
poem: My morning (of love) begins with the thought of you, and the endless possibilities of how much and in what ways I can love you.

title: Grammar of Beauty
poem: Erase everything you've ever imagined beauty to be. After seeing her just once, deeply imbibe the grammar of beauty in your mind.

title: Light of My Night
poem: you are the light that illuminates my entire night

title: Memorized Poem
poem:
She has become a poem memorized by heart, just like the ones I would study all night for exams during my school days. 
I can never forget her for as long as I live. 
Even if they were to wake me up in my grave and ask, I would recite pages and pages about her.

title: Give When She Asks
poem: It's better to give it to her when she asks, because even if you want to give it to her a thousand times later, she won't ask for it even once.

title: Saree Like a Poem’s Last Line
poem: How did you tie the saree so perfectly, as if it were the most beautiful last line of a poem? I was amazed at how much beauty it held.

title: Eighth Wonder
poem: What you wear and take off as your favorite saree is the eighth wonder of the world!

title: Grace of the Sky
poem:
You are the grace of the sky!
The cosmic of beauties!
Untouched by the evil wind!
Undecorated by dirt!
Your silence is the mother of languages!
Your face is the back of the moon!
Your fingerprint lines are the map of eclipses!
Your sweat is the fragrance of the universe!

title: Born to Love Me
poem: I've fallen in love many times... I'm still in love... I'm not bored at all... It's like you were born to love me !!!

title: Always Looking at You
poem: Don't look at me wondering if I'm looking at you. Whenever you look at me, these eyes of mine will always look at you!

title: Moon’s Secret Keeper
poem:
You and Moon should definitely be friends.
If not how did you know?
Only you have the secret to retain beauty even after years...

title: Ants Follow Honey
poem:
You merely walks
And ant colonies, leaping and fighting, following you
Hoping a drop of honey might fall from your body.

title: Mixed in Love
poem: You are mixed in me... I am mixed in you... Love is mixed between us.. What other blessing do I need.. Always thinking of you is the heaven where I live!!!!

title: Calming the Sarees
poem:
Every time I see you in a saree, I want to ask!!!
What did you say to calm the other sarees!!!

title: Heaven in Love
poem: Who cares how the world sees you? Once you find a relationship where you can be yourself, cherish, love, and be loved, the rest of your life is heaven.

title: Moon Beyond Your Face
poem:
You said moon is beautiful!!!
My vision never goes beyond your face to the moon!

title: Ecstatic Eyes
poem:
Even if it's you!
Just seeing you makes my eyes ecstatic like seeing you for the first time!!!

title: Cry Without Hesitation
poem:
How much do you like me!!!
To the point of crying without hesitation in front of you!!!

title: First in Memory
poem:
Before I finish saying it's beautiful... 
You are the first person to come and stick in my memory!!!

title: Clouds Carry the Moon
poem: The clouds that carry away the moon!  Just wait and she will come.  Make it possible for me to rest on her lap this night and enjoy the beauty of the land.  Help me fulfill my heart's long-cherished desire, dear clouds!

title: Beggar for Love
poem:
Thinking I'm a beggar,
Give me alms,
Your love!
For eternity,
At the entrance of your "love" temple,
I will lie down.

title: Beauty Kills, Love Revives
poem:
Oh woman! Your beauty has killed me,
But your love has brought me back to life!

title: Heartbeat Warning
poem:
Oh my heart! Beat slowly,
She is in my heart,
Poor thing, she's about to faint.

title: Beauty Defined by You
poem: The word 'beauty' has meaning only when applied to you.

title: Cleanse My Heart
poem: My heart is filled with impurities. Please come with your love, a cleaning stick, to cleanse it

title: Rose in Your Heart’s Garden
poem: In the garden of your heart, there blooms a rose, its petals soft and fragrant. It's a beauty that captivates my heart

title: Angel Enough
poem: An angel is enough to make life beautiful, only you are enough my angel

title: Clouds in Your Hair
poem: I first saw clouds blooming in the cascade of your hair.

title: Love Amidst Pain
poem: I enjoy life in the midst of pain because of your love..

title: Love Your Fighting
poem: If fighting is your nature, I will love that fighting too

title: Fan of Your Air
poem: I became a fan who loves even the air you breathe because of your "beauty".

title: Gardener to Your Flower
poem: If only you had been born as a “flower plant”, I would have been the gardener to tend it…

title: Candle in Your Grave
poem: Even if you go to the grave, I will be a candle and I will give you "light".

title: Strength in Love
poem: The love I get when I am with you is a kind of "Strength"..

title: Lie of Poetry, Woman of Love
poem: The true beauty of poetry is "lie", the true beauty of love is "woman".

title: Solve the Famine of Love
poem:
You and I live far apart.  And yet, we gift the world with love beyond measure.
In a world of sin, love is scarce.  Let's solve the famine of love, my beauty!

title: Eyes Repent Without Blinking
poem:
For the moment of seeing your photo, my eyes will repent without blinking for a few hundred seconds
I am waiting to see your photo.

title: Journey Now With You
poem:
The long journey of my life ended at your doorstep.  My journey is now with you.
Hurry up, let's travel.  you and me

title: War of Two Eyes
poem:
Love in the world is born in the war where two eyes meet each other.  Waiting, to fight in your eyes,
where are you, my moon

title: Flower of Love Blooms
poem:
You ask for a reason to catch you.  My flower of love blooms only when I see you.
I love you
wait
I am coming to light the flower of love, my love!

title: Need You to Live
poem:
I need you to live.  Waiting, come on.
Let's make love.
Desire of memory in the lap of night.

title: The Reason I Breathe
poem:
If someone asks me why you want to live, your face is the first thing that comes to mind.
My beauty!  Wait, I'm coming.
